The 'Thompson' is an American submachine gun, invented by John T. Thompson in
1919, that became infamous during the Prohibition era. It was a common sight in
the media of the time, being used by both law enforcement officers and
criminals. Ray Bearse, "The Thompson Submachine Gun: Weapon of War and
Peace", in Murtz, Gun Digest Treasury (DBI Books, 1994), p.210 The
Thompson was also known informally as: the "Tommy Gun", "Trench Broom", "Trench
Sweeper", "Chicago Typewriter", "Chicago Piano",
